content.description: Start on the big jug rail, move out left to the arete, work some moves up using the arete and the face, then big move to the top. A SDS could definitely go, probably at the same grade.
content.protection: 1 or 2 pads. Landing seems awful, but once you start working it you soon will realize you fall right under the lip onto the pad every time, don't let the hillside spook you.
content.location: Up the creek a ways from the road (approximately 10 min walk.) In the twin towers cluster, to the left of the river. To the left of the Machete problem.

content.description: Start in horazontal crack reaching high with right hand to gain a good crimp. Step up and follow crack to top out. Walk off climbers right.
content.protection: Two pads and a spotter to keep from a potential fall down the hill.
content.location: To the right of the Left Flake.

content.description: Start on matched crimp in the horizontal crack. Left foot on far ledge and fire for high right sloped arête. Work right hand up and fire left hand to the top. Top out straight on top.
content.location: Above first tier of boulders. Just before the large slab wall on the right.

content.description: Climbs left face and arête. Could go straight up but have not sent yet.
content.protection: Pad on ground and maybe on one the left boulder. Spotter as the ground is fairly sloped.
content.location: Up the creek always on the left side at the base of the hill.

content.description: Start in large horizontal crack, moving up to large flake. Moved gingerly to the top with a high step top out. Walk off climbers right.
content.protection: Two pads and a spotter. The ground is sloped.
content.location: To the right of Problem A. Walking up the boulder creek you'll see it on the right. Can't miss it.

content.description:
Start on a great incut crimp for the right hand, and left hand on a sidepull, pull onto glassy feet and climb the tall overhanging arete with polished crimps down low, grab the arete and rock onto the slab, making delicate moves high off the deck.

The landing for this boulder isnt the best.  Theres a large ledge that you can fill with pads under the face, but after rocking around the arete and committing to the slab, you are exposed over a large rocky pit.

Id highly recommend checking out the slab on rope, theres a large crack at the top of the boulder that takes good gear (#1, #2, #3 C4) and another smaller crack that can be used as a directional (#.5 C4)

A direct line might go, staying on the overhanging face and slapping up the arete.
content.location: First main boulder in the drainage, cant miss it.

content.description: Start at furthest start hold on the left side and traverse right into Dream of the Cat. Bullet hard granite. Bring strong fingers
content.protection: one pad and a spot for the finish moves
content.location: Starts 8 feet left of "Dream of the Cat"
25 feet up from Lar's Arete. This problem sits in a pit and faces uphill

content.description: Overhanging arête on immaculate polished granite. Cooler temps will help with the friction.
content.protection: Two pads and a good spotter
content.location: This problem is approximately 15 feet away and up from Dream of the Cat. The problem faces uphill and starts from a crack/jug on the left side of the boulder. Drop down into the pit to start the problem.

content.description: Sit start into an undercling for the finish.
content.location: Opposite side of the boulder from Contact High
